Description: Define workshop objectives for PQMAP design discussion and establish collaborative format
Discussion:
• Three main objectives: identify pain points, map business as-is processes, define WBS components
• Workshop format using Miro collaborative board
• Participants encouraged to share ideas and comments openly
• Color coding for different teams to track contributions
• Series of 3-4 workshops planned for detailed requirements
Decision (If any): PQMAP design will follow collaborative workshop format with detailed functional design sessions
Action Item (if any):
• Schedule follow-up workshops at Hung Hom or Kai Tak office
• Prepare detailed agenda for subsequent sessions
• Share Miro board link with all participants

Topic: Time-consuming PQ data analysis across systems
Description: Difficulty analyzing PQ data when same event appears in both PQMS and CPDS systems
Discussion:
• Manual correlation needed between PQMS and CPDS data for same events
• Time consuming to merge data from different systems
• Human judgment required to determine correct data values
• Need for unified on-screen analysis rather than report export
Decision (If any): PQMAP will provide single source of truth with unified on-screen data analysis
Action Item (if any):
• Design unified data analysis interface
• Implement data correlation logic between PQMS and CPDS

Description: Difficulty managing meter information spread across PQMS and CPDS with incomplete data
Discussion:
• Different meters in different systems (customer vs CLP meters)
• Missing meter details like addresses and customer data
• Manual Excel tracking for backup transformers
• Need for centralized meter inventory with complete information
• Requirement specification already includes meter inventory feature
Decision (If any): PQMAP will integrate meter information from both systems into unified inventory
Action Item (if any):
• Create unified meter inventory page with all details
• Include backup transformer information
• Integrate data from both PQMS and CPDS

Topic: Manual report generation and dashboard requirements
Description: Time-consuming manual process to create custom reports and charts for management
Discussion:
• Current process requires exporting from PQMS and CPDS to Excel
• Manual work to create charts and analysis for management
• Need for quick dashboard access with flexible date ranges
• Management requests for historical comparisons (year-over-year)
• Fixed table formats limit flexibility for different reporting needs
Decision (If any): PQMAP will implement both dashboard and flexible reporting modules
Action Item (if any):
• Design interactive dashboard with real-time data
• Build flexible reporting with date range selection
• Enable Excel export capabilities for management reports

Description: Need for automated KPI calculation and visualization instead of manual incident-by-incident review
Discussion:
• Current KPI calculation is manual per incident
• Two types: standard PQ indices (EN50160, IEEE 2519) and service-related KPIs
• Need for trend visualization over selected time periods
• Requirement for diagram/chart visualization rather than raw numbers
Decision (If any): PQMAP will provide automated KPI calculation with trend visualization
Action Item (if any):
• Implement automated index calculations
• Create trend charts and visualization tools
• Support both standard compliance and custom KPI definitions

Topic: Single source of truth for data integrity
Description: Address data consistency issues across PQMS and CPDS creating confusion
Discussion:
• Multiple systems storing similar data creates confusion
• Risk of data inconsistency and conflicting information
• Need for unified data governance approach
• PQMAP should consolidate data from both systems
Decision (If any): PQMAP will serve as single source of truth for all PQ data
Action Item (if any):
• Define data governance policies
• Implement data validation and consistency checks

Topic: System integration and data flow architecture
Description: Define data flow from PQMS/CPDS to PQMAP and eventual integration with ADMS
Discussion:
• Phase 1: PQMS and CPDS continue sending data to ADMS while also feeding PQMAP
• PQMAP receives data from both PQMS and CPDS
• Phase 2 (future): PQMAP will send processed data to ADMS, replacing direct PQMS feed
• False positive filtering logic already exists in current PQMS
• PQMAP will inherit and enhance filtering capabilities
Decision (If any): PQMAP will implement phased integration with existing data filtering logic preserved
Action Item (if any):
• Design data ingestion interfaces for PQMS/CPDS
• Plan Phase 2 ADMS integration architecture
• Implement and enhance false positive filtering

Description: Current operational workflow for handling PQ events from detection to resolution
Discussion:
• PQMS receives meter data and performs initial filtering
• False positive detection using device logic at PQMS level
• CPDS also receives events and performs independent filtering
• Both systems store events separately with own filtering rules
• True events proceed to analysis and notification workflow
• Manual verification still required for quality assurance
Decision (If any): PQMAP will maintain existing workflow patterns while centralizing data
Action Item (if any):
• Document complete event handling workflow
• Map all filtering rules from both systems
• Define consolidation strategy

Topic: Event analysis with waveform data and PQ-DIF files
Description: Processing and analysis of PQ events including detailed waveform data
Discussion:
• Events include both statistical data and waveform patterns
• PQ-DIF files contain detailed event information in standard format
• Current systems support waveform analysis
• Need for automated pattern recognition in waveforms
• Integration with existing event validation workflows
Decision (If any): PQMAP will support comprehensive event analysis including waveform visualization
Action Item (if any):
• Implement waveform visualization tools
• Support PQ-DIF file format processing
• Design event analysis workflows with waveform access

Topic: Historical data access and SARFI calculations
Description: Access to historical PQ data through PQDA for index calculations and trend analysis
Discussion:
• PQDA provides 3-year historical data vs PQMS 3-month limit
• SARFI and other indices require historical context for calculation
• Weighting factors updated annually for customer impact calculations
• Each meter has weighting factor based on customer count
• Manual Excel calculations currently supplement system calculations
• Need for flexible time period selection for analysis
Decision (If any): PQMAP will integrate with historical data sources for comprehensive analysis
Action Item (if any):
• Design historical data access interfaces
• Implement SARFI and index calculation engines
• Support flexible date range queries
• Automate weighting factor management

Description: Annual and monthly performance review reports with various analytical views
Discussion:
• Year-over-year trend analysis for event counts and impact
• Circuit-level analysis to identify problematic feeders
• Geographical distribution mapping showing event concentration
• Component analysis (cables, transformers) for failure patterns
• Power BI currently used to create custom visualizations
• Excel-based consolidation of multiple data sources
• Management dashboard requirements for key metrics
Decision (If any): PQMAP will include comprehensive performance reporting with visualization capabilities
Action Item (if any):
• Design performance review templates
• Implement geographical mapping features
• Build trend analysis and comparison tools
• Create management dashboard with key metrics

Topic: PQMAP role as platform vs meter interface
Description: Clarify that PQMAP will replace PQDA while PQMS/CPDS remain as meter interfaces
Discussion:
• PQMS and CPDS continue as proprietary meter interface layers
• PQMAP becomes centralized platform for value-added functions
• All analysis, reporting, and visualization moves to PQMAP
• PQMS/CPDS standardize data format into PQ-DIF before sending to PQMAP
• Future: additional meter brands can be added through standard interface
• PQMAP will be cloud-based for scalability
Decision (If any): PQMAP will serve as cloud platform for all analysis functions while PQMS/CPDS remain as meter interfaces
Action Item (if any):
• Define clear scope boundaries between PQMAP and meter systems
• Design standard data interface format
• Plan cloud deployment architecture

Description: Configure notification strategy for PQ events and system alerts to operators
Discussion:
• Notification types: PQ events, meter disconnect events, watchdog/server anomalies
• Primary recipient: operators who need to see all events
• Secondary recipients: management for selected summaries
• Email as primary notification channel
• Current PQMS has notification capabilities that need migration
• ADMS notifications will continue separately with broader user base
• Need for configurable thresholds and recipient groups
Decision (If any): PQMAP will implement email notification system with configurable settings for operators
Action Item (if any):
• Build notification admin interface for configuration
• Define threshold settings for different event types
• Create recipient group management
• Plan cut-over to disable overlapping PQMS notifications

Description: Need for modern, user-friendly interface compared to legacy systems
Discussion:
• Current PQMS UI considered not visually appealing
• Need for intuitive navigation and improved user experience
• Requirement for access to both QA and production environments
• Team requests demo access to current PQMS UI for reference
Decision (If any): PQMAP will prioritize modern UI/UX design
Action Item (if any):
• Provide QA environment access to vendor team
• Design mockups for key interfaces
• Conduct usability review sessions

Topic: CSV import for transformer relationship data
Description: Manual data import requirement for transformer relationships until ADMS integration
Discussion:
• Transformer relationship data exists in ADMS
• Shows connection between customer transformers and CLP transformers
• Phase 1: Manual CSV import as workaround
• Phase 2: Direct integration with ADMS for automated sync
• Needed for comprehensive analysis of meter relationships
Decision (If any): PQMAP will support CSV import for transformer data as interim solution
Action Item (if any):
• Design CSV import interface with validation
• Define data format specifications
• Plan future ADMS integration for automated sync

Description: Special handling for meter disconnection events requiring investigation
Discussion:
• Disconnection events stored separately for analysis
• May indicate communication issues rather than power quality problems
• Need to distinguish between genuine PQ events and meter issues
• Reconnection events should be linked to disconnection for complete picture
• Operators need notification of disconnection events
Decision (If any): PQMAP will track and correlate meter disconnection/reconnection events
Action Item (if any):
• Design disconnection event tracking
• Implement event correlation logic
• Add to notification system

Description: Integration of PQ customer service records for comprehensive case management
Discussion:
• Second team handles customer service for PQ issues
• Service records currently maintained separately
• Need to link service actions to PQ events
• Operators may suggest corrective actions to customers
• Service team needs to document interactions and recommendations
• Historical service record import required
Decision (If any): PQMAP will integrate customer service record management
Action Item (if any):
• Design service record data model
• Build interface for service team data entry
• Implement historical data import capability
• Link service records to PQ events

Description: Clarify project timeline expectations and vendor participation readiness
Discussion:
• Official project start expected mid-December 2025
• Vendor team eager to accelerate delivery
• Functional design phase must complete before technical design
• Series of workshops needed to gather detailed requirements
• 3-4 workshop sessions anticipated
• Requirement specifications need refinement to implementation-ready detail
Decision (If any): Project will follow structured approach: functional design workshops, then technical design
Action Item (if any):
• Confirm official project start date
• Schedule remaining workshop sessions
• Prepare detailed requirement specifications
• Set up collaboration tools and document sharing
